DataElement.preferredName: Nucleic Acid Amplification Test Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1 Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The day month and year that nucleic acid amplification test (NAT) for human immunodeficiency virus (HIV-1) was performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Nucleic Acid Amplification Test Human Immunodeficiency Virus 1
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of microorganism contamination in blood. It is most frequently used to detect recent viral infection in individuals during the latency period before seroconversion but can also be used to detect other types of blood contamination._The type species of lentivirus and the etiologic agent of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). It is characterized by its cytopathic effect and affinity for the T4-lymphocyte.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

Concepts.definition: Any of various amplification and detection strategies applied to detection of virus contamination in donor blood.  Specifically designed to detect recently infected individuals during the latency period before seroconversion.

Property.preferredDefinition: The type species of lentivirus and the etiologic agent of acquired immunodeficiency syndrome (AIDS). It is characterized by its cytopathic effect and affinity for the T4-lymphocyte.

Concepts.definition: Any viral organism that can be assigned to the species Human Immunodeficiency virus 1.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.
